results.title: The Cardiovascular Benefits and Infections Risk of SGLT2i versus Metformin in Type 2 Diabetes: A Systemic Review and Meta-Analysis
results.text_hl: Based on these findings, SGLT2i provided the similar antihyperglycemic effects, additional cardiovascular benefits, and a potential @<m>DISEASE_Reproductive_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060737 @@@RTI@@@ risk compared with that of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

results.title: Effect of metformin on the endometrial proteome of diet-induced obese mice.
results.text_hl: There is evidence that the endometrial function is altered in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ and/or @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin@@@ resistant @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, an insulin-sensitizing drug, has shown potential in treating @<m>DISEASE_Reproductive_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060737 @@@metabolic and reproductive disorders@@@, including @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@ (@DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@) and may enhance fertility outcomes by improving @DISEASE_Uterine_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014591 @@@endometrial dysfunction@@@.

results.title: Effect of Hypoglycemic Drugs on Kisspeptin Expression in the Hypothalamic Arcuate Nucleus of PCOS Rats
results.text_hl: The expression of hypothalamic @GENE_KISS1 @GENE_289023 @@@Kiss1@@@ may play an important role in the pathogenesis of @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Acarbose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020909 @@@acarbose@@@ may reduce the expression of hypothalamic @GENE_KISS1 @GENE_289023 @@@Kiss1@@@ by improving @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@, thereby improving @<m>DISEASE_Reproductive_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060737 @@@reproductive and metabolic disorders@@@ in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Therapeutic metformin concentrations positively regulate proliferation in endometrial epithelial cells via mTOR activation and augmented mitochondrial strength.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, an antidiabetic drug, has recently been repositioned in the treatment of several @DISEASE_Congenital_Hereditary_and_Neonatal_Diseases_and_Abnormalities @DISEASE_MESH:D009358 @@@nondiabetic disorders@@@, including @<m>DISEASE_Reproductive_Tract_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D060737 @@@reproductive disorders@@@ such as @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovarian syndrome@@@, where it improves endometrial functions.

citations.NLM: Imran M, Sachdeva G, Menon S, Das D, Davuluri S, Acharya K, Chaudhari U. Therapeutic metformin concentrations positively regulate proliferation in endometrial epithelial cells via mTOR activation and augmented mitochondrial strength. Can J Physiol Pharmacol. 2023 Jan 1;101(1):52-64. PMID: 36322951
